record.dc:title: 16Mg66 Penn Site, Morgan County, Alabama. Feature #15, a large possible burial pit with no traces of burial remains in 40R2 at 0.40' below surface.
record.dc:creator: Wayne W. Kraxberger
record.wpa:narrative: Feature #15, possible burial pit, in 40R2 at 0.40' below surface. Pit was narrow and very deep and had irregular sides. Fill was a blue clay loam mixed with a black loam and an iron stained clay. The pit tapered from 2.5' at the top to 1.0' width at the bottom. Greenstone spade (F.S. #25), (F.S. #33) 17 pieces of worked stone, and (F.S. #34) sherds came from the pit filling. The pit is 4.45' in depth. The photo was taken from the southwest.
